tool.name: VCF Files to VEuPathDB VDI
tool.description: Export one or more VCF files to VEuPathDB My Data Set where they can be viewed as tracks in the Genome Browser for the approriate organism.

param.name: dataset_name
param.label: VEuPathDB Data Set name:
param.help: This name will allow you to readily identify and apply this dataset in VEuPathDB

validator.message: Only letters, numbers, spaces and dashes are allowed in the name.
Please restrict the name to 100 characters or less.

param.name: vcf_files
param.label: VCF files:
param.help: Select the files to copy to your VEuPathDB My Data Set. The VCF files you select here must be mapped to the reference genome that you select below.

param.name: overrideDbkey
param.label: Reference genome:
param.help: The VCF files you selected above must be mapped to the reference genome that you select here.

param.name: summary
param.label: VEuPathDB Data Set summary:
param.help: This summary will appear in your VEuPathDB My Data Set page. (Any double quotes will be coverted to single quotes.)

param.name: description
param.label: VEuPathDB Data Set description:
param.help: This description will appear on the VEuPathDB My Data Set details page. (Any double quotes will be coverted to single quotes.)

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**What it does** (check this Tutorial_!)
This tool exports one or more VCF files to a VEuPathDB site creating a new My Data Set to contain them. Typically the VCF files in your My Data Set should belong to one Study. The reference genome you specify determines which VEuPathDB site the new My Data Set will be exported to. For example, if you choose P.falciparum 3D7 the export will be sent to PlasmoDB.org.
.. _PlasmoDB.org: http://plasmodb.org .. _Tutorial: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=igQZHjRBqV0
